title: Changes Around Us
description: Learn about different types of changes in our surroundings and their characteristics.

questions.question: Which of these is a physical change?
questions.explanation: Melting of ice is a physical change because it only changes the state of water from solid to liquid, without forming a new substance.

questions.question: What type of change is the formation of rust?
questions.explanation: Formation of rust is a chemical change because it involves a reaction between iron and oxygen to form a new substance (iron oxide).

questions.question: Which of these is a reversible change?
questions.explanation: Melting of wax is a reversible change because the wax can be melted and solidified again without forming a new substance.

questions.question: What type of change is the ripening of fruits?
questions.explanation: Ripening of fruits is a chemical change because it involves changes in the chemical composition of the fruit.

questions.question: Which of these is an irreversible change?
questions.explanation: Burning of paper is an irreversible change because the paper cannot be converted back to its original form after burning.

questions.question: What type of change is the formation of curd from milk?
questions.explanation: Formation of curd from milk is a chemical change because it involves the conversion of milk into a new substance (curd) through bacterial action.

questions.question: Which of these is a temporary change?
questions.explanation: Melting of ice is a temporary change because it can be reversed by cooling the water back to ice.

questions.question: What type of change is the formation of clouds?
questions.explanation: Formation of clouds is a physical change because it only involves a change in the state of water from liquid to gas and back to liquid.

questions.question: Which of these is a permanent change?
questions.explanation: Burning of wood is a permanent change because the wood cannot be converted back to its original form after burning.

questions.question: What type of change is the formation of dew?
questions.explanation: Formation of dew is a physical change because it only involves a change in the state of water from gas to liquid.
